Build Selected Figures from an ssi_run

Source: R/make_figures.R
make_figures.Rd

Convenience wrapper to generate either the Ohlberger figures (2–7), the Kuskokwim figures (A–C), or a user-specified subset.

Usage

make_figures(
  figures = "Kuskokwim",
  data,
  figure_dir = file.path(here::here(), "figures")
)

Arguments

figures

Character vector indicating what to build. Examples: "Ohlberger", "Kuskokwim", c("A","C"), c("2","5"). Defaults to "Kuskokwim".

data

Either an ssi_run object (from run_scenarios()) or a file path to a saved .rds containing an ssi_run.

figure_dir

Directory to save figures (default: here()/figures).

Value

Invisible named list of results for each figure generated.

Details

  • "Ohlberger" builds Figures 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

  • "Kuskokwim" builds Figures A, B, C.

  • You can also pass explicit figure codes, e.g. c("A","C") or c("2","5"). (Case-insensitive; "Figure5" also works.)
